channel.description: Latest news updates from HindustanTimes.com for IndiaSectionPage-Topstories. For more updates hop on to HindustanTimes.com.

item.title: Mathematics-wizard-Shakuntala-Devi-dies-at-83
item.description: Legendary Mathematics wizard Shakuntala Devi, dubbed as the world's fastest 'human computer' and who made complex mental calculations as a child prodigy, died at a hospital in Bangalore on Sunday following respiratory problems.

item.title: One-month-old-baby-boy-sold-for-Rs-1-5-lakh-in-Andhra-Pradesh
item.description: Two persons including the baby's father, a labourer and one mediator, allegedly sold the baby 10 days ago, the police said, quoting a complaint lodged by the Integrated Child Development Services authorities.
item.itunes:subtitle: Two persons including the baby's father, a labourer and one mediator, allegedly sold the baby 10 days ago, the police said, quoting a complaint lodged by the Integrated Child Development Services authorities.
item.itunes:summary: Two persons including the baby's father, a labourer and one mediator, allegedly sold the baby 10 days ago, the police said, quoting a complaint lodged by the Integrated Child Development Services authorities.

item.title: Delhi-minor-rape-mother-in-law-of-accused-says-he-should-be-hanged
item.description: Mother-in-law of Manoj Kumar, who was arrested for allegedly raping a five-year-old girl in Delhi, today said he should be hanged for the "bestial act", while his wife sought stringent punishment for him if the charge was true.

item.title: Mentally-challenged-woman-raped-by-ward-boy-docs-try-to-bribe-kin
item.description: A 22-year-old mentally-challenged woman was raped allegedly by a ward boy at a nursing home whose doctors have been arrested on charge of trying to bribe the victim's kin to hush up the matter.
item.itunes:subtitle: A 22-year-old mentally-challenged woman was raped allegedly by a ward boy at a nursing home whose doctors have been arrested on charge of trying to bribe the victim's kin to hush up the matter.
item.itunes:summary: A 22-year-old mentally-challenged woman was raped allegedly by a ward boy at a nursing home whose doctors have been arrested on charge of trying to bribe the victim's kin to hush up the matter.

item.title: Collective-efforts-needed-to-end-depravity-PM
item.description: As protests against the gruesome rape on a five-year-old girl in New Delhi intensified, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh today said collective efforts were needed to root out such "depravity" from society.

item.title: Protests-in-Delhi-over-rape-of-minor-girl-PM-for-collective-efforts-to-end-depravity
item.description: Women and student activists on Sunday converged near India Gate, which had witnessed largescale anti-rape protests in December last, demanding justice for the five-year-old rape victim in the national capital. Rape victim's condition improving: Doctor
item.itunes:subtitle: Women and student activists on Sunday converged near India Gate, which had witnessed largescale anti-rape protests in December last, demanding justice for the five-year-old rape victim in the national capital. Rape victim's condition improving: Doctor&nbs
item.itunes:summary: Women and student activists on Sunday converged near India Gate, which had witnessed largescale anti-rape protests in December last, demanding justice for the five-year-old rape victim in the national capital. Rape victim's condition improving: Doctor

item.title: 1993-blasts-case-Sanjay-Dutt-files-review-petition
item.description: Days after being granted one more month to surrender, actor Sanjay Dutt has filed a review petition in the Supreme Court challenging his conviction and five-year jail term in the 1993 Mumbai serial blasts case.

item.title: AAP-activists-protest-outside-PM-s-residence
item.description: A group of Aam Aadmi Party activists today tried to stage a protest demanding removal of Delhi Police Commissioner Neeraj Kumar outside Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's residence and were detained.

item.title: 3-4-magnitude-earthquake-shakes-Assam
item.description: An earthquake of mild intensity measuring 3.4 on the Richter scale shook Assam on Sunday, the third within a week to rock the state.

item.title: Wife-of-key-accused-in-rape-case-pleads-his-innocence
item.description: The wife of Manoj, the prime accused in the brutal rape of a five-year old girl in New Delhi, has declared her husband is innocent and demanded his release amid nationwide protests.

item.title: Arrested-for-raping-6-yr-old-man-attempts-suicide
item.description: A man in his mid-thirties was arrested this morning for allegedly raping and murdering a six-year-old girl in Aligarh, which was rocked by violent protests against the incident.

item.title: Serving-mukhia-held-in-1988-kidnap-case
item.description: Over a period of 15 years after he was declared absconding in a criminal case, a man contested a Lok Sabha poll and two assembly elections, before ending up as the mukhia of a village panchayat in north Bihar.

item.title: Death-penalty-for-child-rapists-should-be-considered-CPI-M
item.description: BJP leader Sushma Swaraj's demand for death penalty to child rapists today got the backing of CPI(M) which said it was open to the idea.

item.title: RIL-chairman-Mukesh-Ambani-gets-Z-category-security
item.description: RIL chairman Mukesh Ambani is the new entrant to the 'Z' category VIP security club after the Union home ministry recently approved an armed commando squad following threat perception to the business tycoon.

item.title: Most-read-stories-on-HT
item.description: Sitting on a huge cash pile of nearly Rs 83,000 crore, polyester-to-petroleum-to-retail conglomerate has earned close to Rs. 8,000 crore through its treasury operations - investments of surplus funds in financial markets - during last fiscal.

item.title: Delhi-minor-rape-victim-s-condition-improving-Doctor
item.description: The condition of the five-year-old rape victim is "gradually" improving but it will be at least two weeks before she is discharged from the hospital in the capital where activists today staged protests demanding resignation of Delhi Police chief.
item.itunes:subtitle: The condition of the five-year-old rape victim is "gradually" improving but it will be at least two weeks before she is discharged from the hospital in the capital where activists today staged protests demanding resignation of Delhi Police chief. &nb
item.itunes:summary: The condition of the five-year-old rape victim is "gradually" improving but it will be at least two weeks before she is discharged from the hospital in the capital where activists today staged protests demanding resignation of Delhi Police chief.

item.title: Meteor-showers-to-be-visible-after-midnight-tonight
item.description: A celestial treat is in store for stargazers who can look forward to see fireworks in the form of meteor showers after midnight today.

item.title: 19-year-old-tribal-gangraped-by-three-persons
item.description: A 19-year-old tribal woman was allegedly gangraped by three persons in Chatra district, police sources said today.

item.title: Direct-cash-transfer-to-curb-wastages-leakages-PM
item.description: Centre's ambitious direct cash transfer scheme will help in better targeting of subsidies and reducing delay in delivery of benefits besides curbing wastages and leakages, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh said in New Delhi today.

item.title: Meet-on-RS-functioning-fails-Oppn-shoots-down-Ansari-s-proposals
item.description: Expressing agony and distress over the continuous disruptions of the House, Vice President and Rajya Sabha chairman Hamid Ansari today called for change in rules of Question Hour. His suggestions were shot down by the Opposition.
item.itunes:subtitle: Expressing agony and distress over the continuous disruptions of the House, Vice President and Rajya Sabha chairman Hamid Ansari today called for change in rules of Question Hour. His suggestions were shot down by the Opposition.  &nbs
item.itunes:summary: Expressing agony and distress over the continuous disruptions of the House, Vice President and Rajya Sabha chairman Hamid Ansari today called for change in rules of Question Hour. His suggestions were shot down by the Opposition.

item.title: Wanted-Maoist-leader-arrested
item.description: A Maoist leader, wanted for several incidents of murder, was today arrested from the Chitrakonda area of Malkangiri district.

item.title: Delhi-minor-s-rape-Protests-continue-for-second-day
item.description: Scores of people protesting the rape of a 5-year-old girl descended at police headquarters and Congress chief Sonia Gandhi's residence on the second consecutive day on Sunday raising slogans and demanding removal of Police Commissioner Neeraj Kumar.
item.itunes:subtitle: Scores of people protesting the rape of a 5-year-old girl descended at police headquarters and Congress chief Sonia Gandhi's residence on the second consecutive day on Sunday raising slogans and demanding removal of Police Commissioner Neeraj Kumar.
item.itunes:summary: Scores of people protesting the rape of a 5-year-old girl descended at police headquarters and Congress chief Sonia Gandhi's residence on the second consecutive day on Sunday raising slogans and demanding removal of Police Commissioner Neeraj Kumar.

item.title: People-look-at-Modi-as-a-strong-leader-Uma-Bharti
item.description: Amid growing clamour to declare Gujarat chief minister Narendra Modi as the prime ministerial candidate of BJP, party vice president Uma Bharti said on Sunday that people look at him as a strong leader, as they want someone who can tackle issues like terrorism and naxalism.

item.title: Imphal-One-Jawan-killed-7-injured-as-insurgents-ambush-official-team
item.description: A Manipur rifles jawan was killed and seven others including an executive engineer were injured when suspected insurgents ambushed an official team in Khudengtabi area of Chandel district bordering Myanmar today, official reports said.

item.title: Rajnath-in-no-hurry-to-declare-BJP-s-PM-choice
item.description: Allies JD(U) and Shiv Sena may be piling pressure on BJP to declare its prime ministerial candidate to checkmate Narendra Modi's nomination but the saffron party president Rajnath Singh is in no great hurry to oblige.
